chargeHist.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st Degree Sexual Assault)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Dustin Thomas Ehrich was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st Degree Sexual Assault), a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.025(1)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
11:03  Defendant Dustin Thomas Ehrich in court with attorney Philip A. Helgeson.  Defendant Dustin Thomas Ehrich in custody.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Froelich  addresses.   15 yrs in WI prison system  10 1/2/ yr conf & 4 1/2 yr ES  conc to sentence now serving in MN.   No contact with victim  DOB 8/15/06 .   DNA, Sex Off registration, Sex Offender Treatment. Statements are given to the court. Atty Helgeson addresses.  381 days total credit. Requests the court adopt the State's recomendation. 
The Court orders 15 years in the WI State Prison System     10 1/2 yrs confinement.   4 1/2 yrs extended supervision. This sentence is consecutive to MN sentence now serving   Conditions of ES  Sex offender registration as required by WI Law. , DNA sample,  DNA Surcharge $250.00  No contact with the victim  JRF  DOB 08/15/06. Successful comptetion of Sex Offender Treatment.  Restitution to be determined.  381 days credit.   Appeal rights are given to the defendant. 11:42
Sentencing hearing on March 16, 2018 at 11:00 am.

4:07 Defendant Dustin Thomas Ehrich in court with attorney Philip A. Helgeson.  Defendant Dustin Thomas Ehrich in custody.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Froelich: alford plea to charge. 15 year sentence: 10.5 years initial confinement and 4.5 years ES, concurrent to MN sentence. No contact with victim. Sex offender registry and programming. DNA sample and surcharge. restitution TBD and 1 year custody credit. Atty Helgeson agrees,  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Def pleas guilty pursuant to Alford. Atty Froelich gives prosecuting summary. Atty Helgeson stipulates that the jury would return a verdict of guilty. Atty Helgeson stipulates to the facts of the complaint.  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA of guilty pursuant to Alford. maintaining his innonence, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS. Court finds and adjudicates the Def guilty based on the facts given. Froelich: sentencing at a later time to comply with victim's rights.
Final pre-trial on February 28, 2018 at 03:45 pm.
State's Voir Dire questions filed by Atty Froelich
Criminal Jury Trial Scheduling

Final pre-trial on February 26, 2018 at 09:15 am.
Jury trial on March 15, 2018 at 08:30 am.

03:26 Defendant Dustin Thomas Ehrich in court with attorney Philip A. Helgeson.  Defendant Dustin Thomas Ehrich in custody.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Froelich, possible plea but no agreement, proceed with motion. Both parties have filed briefs. Court 180 day time limit expired May 16, agreement for motion hearing that day, court--request for motion hearing at that time considers that waiver. Froelich reviews transcripts, waiver by conduct. Atty Helgeson addresses the court. Court reviews cases cited by State in brief, State v. Brown, State v. Aukes. Court, constitutes waiver by conduct and waived time limits, court denies motion, schedule trial--September 21 and 22, parties to see JA for final pre-trial date. 03:46
